name: Moevenpick Hotel Istanbul

reviews.text: Stayed here on a recent work trip. Very classy, stylish. Excellent facilities, great customer service. Rooms really smart and have a fresh feel to them. Good location for business and also not too far from down town in a cab unless it is rush hour!
reviews.title: Brilliant for business

reviews.text: I spent 5 days at this wonderful hotel. It is in a great location, the subway is just a few steps from the hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff is extraordinarily nice and very helpful. The bellboy Masuk greeted us every time with a great smile and referred to us with our private names, which was heartwarming. The receptionist Zuhal tried every possibility to help us. The only thing that bothered me was the high price of the breakfast… You should try the wonderful pastries at the Gourmet. My next stay in Istanbul will definitely be there.
reviews.title: Great hotel for business and pleasure!

reviews.text: Great service, spacious and clean rooms, breakfast and food is good. Service is outstanding. However, if you want to do some sightseeing, this is far from tourist sites, so I would only stay here if the purpose of your trip is business and you will be visiting an office nearby.
reviews.title: Great hotel for business

reviews.text: I have nothing but praise for the Hotel, its staff and general ambience. The great service and friendliness started with the warm and helpful members of the "Bell Team" Haluk and Murat and extended throughout our stay. Room had stunning views of Istanbul, was elegantly designed and covered all needs, and superbly clean. Breakfast in the morning was a special highlight. I was there with a family member who was attendin a conference but my stay was purely for pleasure: we both found the hotel to be first class for our needs. The location was also excellent as it was cenral and very close to the Istanbul Metro station 4.Levent. Couldn't be happier.
reviews.title: First class Hotel & First Class Staff

reviews.text: I had a wonderful stay at Movenpick, Istanbul. Reception on arrival was excellent. The staff was very friendly. Rooms were very clean and well designed. Even got a good view of the street fro my room. The facilities provided in the room make your stay very comfortable. Breakfast in the morning was a feast. Overall experience - I loved it !
reviews.title: I loved it

reviews.text: The hotel is good, very comfortable and clean room, the size of the room is so good and it is very well decorated. bathroom is so clean and decorated too. you can feel Swiss standards all over the place. the quality of food is spectacular. it is a great hotel for business but if you are a tourist is not ideal for you while the traffic is so heavy most of the times and the hotel is not close to anywhere, but if you want to spend your money for valuable services and also quality, Moevenpick is a right choice for you!
reviews.title: Exellent Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for in early May 2013. She is familiar with the travel industry and was familiar with the hotel but it was a surprise for me. Other hotels we have seen in Istanbul are very pricey and not really a 4 or 5 star. The Movenpick is an exception. The staff and service we received were excellent. Pinar greeted us with a warm welcome and checked us into our room. She was also helpful in setting up a doctors appointment. Arda took us to our room and pointed out everything we might need (time for breakfast, gym, items and services available) . The restaurant manager, Sayit Sahin, did an excellent job ensuring we were well taken care of. My wife stated that this hotel really offers the service its star rating states and I can now see the difference. The hotel is located in the business district a short taxi ride away from shopping (such as Bebeck area) and about a 30-60 minute ride from the airport depending on traffic.I highly recommend this hotel. Thanks again to the wonderful staff who made our stay so enjoyable.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
Value for money
reviews.text: The hotel is very good, Movenpick standards, the service and the rooms are excellent, the free ice cream is a nice plus and the rates are outstanding. The trade off, you feel like you are in a fairy tale, far, far away....which with the traffic in Istanbul is not good if you are a tourist.

Spacious, stylish rooms. Perfect breakfasts.Excellent location for business purposes, it was walking distance from my office. But it is very difficult to get to old town, so if you want make some sightseeing, choose different hotel.Nice swimming pool & jacuzzi & sauna - perfect to relax after work. I highly recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent for business

reviews.text: A very nice hotel in the business district close to businesses , good restaurants and the Bosphorus . A little bit expensive like other nice hotels in Istanbul. Rooms are perfect. Bathrooms nice and modern .
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is new, the personnel is excellent. However is far from the airport and far from the tourist attractions. You only have two shopping malls nearby but if you stick to that you will be in the US and not in Istanbul! Price wise: a little overpriced.
reviews.title: Convenient only for business

reviews.text: If you are visiting Istanbul either for leisure or business this is the best place to stay. Its location is great and staff is excellent. The rooms and towels are perfectly clean and the restaurant is great.
reviews.title: Excellent location and great Hotel.

reviews.text: As usual , the Moevenpick is a good choice in city hotels , this hotel is one of the best in Istanbul. Watch out the breakfast buffet, it is dangerous, you will eat the triple of what you have planned "if you are planning for a light breakfast don't go to the restaurant , going to the restaurant is at your own risk" . Well we did enjoy the breakfast buffet very much. The hotel is located at "4 Levent" which is far from the downtown but it's next to the underground station which is the best way to move from the hotel to Takseem and back because of the traffic . the area of the hotel is noisy but the windows are super isolated .We are highly recommending this hotel for business or pleasure. The staff are the high light of the hotel , very professional and friendly .
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and we found the hotel to be of high quality, clean, new and the staff were very helpful and professional. Our Superior room was on the 5th floor and was spacious. We enjoyed the in room dining service, the food was of high quality and the staff would prepare our food to a high standards. Those who complain about the price, should not stay at a five star hotel. However if you stay here, then try the food. If you stay in the executive room, this is on a higher floor with access to a bar and other services. However we were very happy with our room.
reviews.title: I will recommend this hotel to those traveling to Istanbul.

reviews.text: The hotel is right next to the metro, you can be in the new Istanbul in 10 minutes and be in the old Istanbul in 20. By taxi it may take a bit longer. We would sometimes leave Taxim at 11:45pm and use the metro to get back as it's safe.
reviews.title: Nice 5 star hotel with impeccable service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights here early May. Very good, nice and clean, however did miss the Turkish bath. The other two Istanbul hotels had a nice Turkish bath. This hotels looks like it is out of the way but only 4 or 5 stops on the Metro to Taksim (and no traffic). Metro stop is right around the corner from the Hotel (just exit the correct one if not you will end up on the other side of the freeway). We were I think on the 16 floor - great views. Look at all the traffic and go yeah - we take the underground metro - no traffic
reviews.title: Nice place - not as far as you think

reviews.text: The housekeeping was the best by far and overall maybe the best stay during our trip to Turkey. They had a promotional rate (no breakfast) and the rates were lower than some of the places closer to Taksim.
reviews.title: Ideal location for business stay on European side & upscale shopping; excellent service!

reviews.text: One thing that impressed me after our return is that I received a survey via e-mail. I completed it and lo and behold someone read it and responded to it in detail. One minor thing that I pointed out was the fact that some of the computers had keyboards that are not the same as US. For example the @ sign - is elsewhere - so in binary it is different and does not recognize it. She even addressed that - that is 5 star service. This hotel also charges for Wi-Fi, but the business center is free.
reviews.title: Fit with my needs
Very good business hotel
reviews.text: Two things that I did not like, at check in they were pushing to upsell. For 70 more Euros per night you can have this and that, including breakfast - no was not good enough. I understand sales, but don't be too pushy. The other is the cost of restaurant, mini bar and anything was quite pricey. I am not going to take anything away as these are disclosed prices and not like a scam.
I gave the hotel a TA sticker (reviewed on TA.com) - hope they are using it.
reviews.title: Excellent Facilities and Staff

description: Welcome to Istanbul. Mövenpick Hotel Istanbul, located in the heart of Istanbul’s contemporary business and chic shopping district, has crowned its achievements by being voted “Turkey's Leading Business Hotel” by World Travel Awards in 2012. Mövenpick Hotel Istanbul offers style and the latest technology in 249 guestrooms created with the discerning traveller in mind, just seconds from some of the city’s hippest dining and entertainment. The metro station next to the hotel will take you to the colourful Taksim Square, cultural district in just 10 minutes.
